description: The GetType operation returns information about the type, for example the field definitions, the timestamp when the type was last modified, the level of nesting, the status, and details about if the type is used in other types and tables. To read keyspace metadata using GetType, the IAM principal needs Select action permissions for the system keyspace. To configure the required permissions, see Permissions to view a UDT in the Amazon Keyspaces Developer Guide.

parameters.name: keyspaceName
parameters.description: The name of the keyspace that contains this type.

parameters.name: typeName
parameters.description: The formatted name of the type. For example, if the name of the type was created without double quotes, Amazon Keyspaces saved the name in lower-case characters. If the name was created in double quotes, you must use double quotes to specify the type name.

nested_items.name: keyspaceName
nested_items.description: The name of the keyspace that contains this type.

nested_items.name: fieldDefinitions
nested_items.description: The names and types that define this type.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: Any supported Cassandra data type, including collections and other user-defined types that are contained in the same keyspace.

nested_items.name: lastModifiedTimestamp
nested_items.description: The timestamp that shows when this type was last modified.

nested_items.name: directReferringTables
nested_items.description: The tables that use this type.

nested_items.name: directParentTypes
nested_items.description: The types that use this type.

nested_items.name: maxNestingDepth
nested_items.description: The level of nesting implemented for this type.

nested_items.name: keyspaceArn
nested_items.description: The unique identifier of the keyspace that contains this type in the format of an Amazon Resource Name (ARN).
